docs.title: Phone calls choppy when using wifi calling after Nougat
docs.text: s i have an s7 edge, and i have fairly poor service when i'm in my house, and especially in my basement. i always have wifi calling turned on when i'm at home and that was perfect for me up until i updated my phone to nougat, and now i'm noticing that my phone calls have intermittent static and i'm unable to hear the other person for a few seconds. i have verizon fios at home and a very fast internet connection so i don't think it's a problem there, and it only started happening after i updated. the same thing happens when i'm at work so it doesn't appear to be specific to my home network. also, i did a factory reset as soon as i updated my phone to 7.0.has anyone else noticed this since nougat come out, and have any ideas as to how i can fix it?

docs.title: So upset

docs.title: Where is our $600 promotion?
docs.text: w switched to wwireless in early december. the store employees were nice but did not know anything about our new iphones and the whole process took almost 3 hours. we left with the instructions and paperwork to submit for the $600 for the two iphone 6s that we turned in.as our verizon account was closed getting documents was not easy- but after many hours on the phone we got proof that our account was paid off. we put everything together and with forms completed sent it all in. yesterday we got a postcard telling us that we did not provide adequate information and that we have to resubmit by 3/14/2017. we are educated professionals and know how to submit paperwork. this sounds a lot like a scam. we want the $600 promised returned to us asap. in the meantime our wwirelessorney will be drafting a letter. wwireless should not be doing this to new customers. shameful.

docs.title: Discount denied for asking questions?
docs.text: bfore leaving for my trip, i called to arrange for the wwireless passport plan, and even set up which countries i would be visiting. from the moment i arrived in the first country, my phone did not work. i spent nearly an hour on a friend's verizon phone with an wwireless tech, trying to resolve the problem.wwireless was unable to resolve the problem. i was without a phone for two weeks.today i called to ask for a refund for the plan i purchased. i also asked to have two weeks of my regular phone plan refunded since it was useless to me for the half month.they offered me an amount they believed was fair, which was not unfair, but i asked about how to make sure this doesn't happen again when i travel and why my friends using verizon had no problem whatsoever. the only way i could get an answer to that was to ask to talk to a manager/supervisor.the manager supervisor then told me that i had "declined the offered discount" - which i had not - and told me there was no way to make sure that my phone would work overseas.i asked if there were technical records of any kind kept by the service tech who tried to fix the problem (as i sat connected through wifi rom london heathrow airport) so that we could narrow down the problem and see if it was my specific phone and the manager said "no."so, wwireless, the people who built the world's communication networks and the internet, do not keep computerized records? the best we could hope for was to take my phone and have it diagnosed at an wwireless store - which i said i would do, but that i am in disbelief that there is no way to access the computerized records of a guy using a computer to work on my phone.anyhow, she refused to again offer me the discount to keep me as a customer - a customer who had not yet decided to leave wwireless.do i have any recourse?

docs.title: Upgrade - Charged For Returning Incorrect Phone
docs.text: o whom it may concern,necessary information: i came over to wwireless in march or april of 2016 and signed up for a new account on a phone installment plan for the iphone 6.in september of 2016 i opted to upgrade to the iphone 7 plus after logging into my account and seeing that i could upgrade early. as i was doing so and going through the steps, the wwireless website asked me to please send back my current device.it did not list what device wwireless was expecting, it just said my "current device". so i did exactly this.when i recieved my new iphone 7 plus, i sent back the device i had switched to weeks before (lg g4) because theiphone had been acting strange.when i contacted customer service they had told me they were expecting an iphone 6 and if it was not returned i would be billed the remaining amount on the phone that i owed. i said okay, awesome - please send me back the lg g4 and i'll get this back to you asap.i was on the phone with over 6 representatives and 2 managers who told me that they could not contact the warehouse because it's an offline team. they also went on to say i would not be getting my lg g4 back and if i did not want to be charged over 400.00 for the iphone 6 i should send that in, too.now call me crazy but how is this a legal practice? your website tells me to send in my "current device", so i do. then you tell me it's not the device you were expecting but refuse to send me back a 300-400.00 phone that i sent by mistake and on-top of that also want the iphone 6?i never sent the iphone 6 back or the 7 plus and was charged over 1,000.00 with my current bill for not doing so. i am unhappy with wwireless's practices and even more upset no one helped me even after confirming that the warehouse did recieve the lg g4.how can i get some help and resolve this?

docs.title: accidental bending damage and questions of warrenty coverage
docs.text: s i have already seen a bit about the warrenties only covering mechanical failures but i'm not sure if thats the same thing as the warrenty that you purchase when you buy the device. i have have a iphone 6s that i have had only for 8 months and still owe over 400 dollars on and but unlucky change it got bend up as i got into my car and it got caught in my coat pocket and the car door. i don't really see this as wear and tear and its not like a scratch or weathering. it was accidental and i think there might be room to argue. if anything maybe i should just contact ottor box since its their case that failed to protect it. i was just hoping to hear some others input since the only stories i have read that were like mine were from 2010 and that information might be out of date.

docs.title: If I file a lost  iPhone claim will AT&T automatically suspend or reset the phone?
docs.text: reciently lost my iphone and made a claim reporting it. i lost it in a state park and was told by family freinds that it was most likely picked up and sold. will wwireless automatically lock, suspent, or reset the phone so no one can use it? i am worried about my information being stolen or wrongly used. if they were able to unlock my phone after i made the claim would they be able to see my emails, notes, text messages, etc? is there any way to clear that information off the lost phone?

docs.title: Mr. Chelius
docs.text: would like the contact information to make a formal complaint on a customer service representative donta [edited for privacy  please do not post personal information]

docs.title: Need Regional Manager to contact me immediately.
docs.text: ecember 26, 2016 the wwireless store located at 2204 university drive in coral springsflorida applied a charge to my account of $49 and change for six installments for an "accessory" that was never purchased. wwireless customer service had no description or paperwork on what the item was and after two and a half hours on the phone was told that we would have to go to the wwireless store that placed this charge on our accountto have it corrected. went to the at& t store and after two more hours and them looking everywhere, it was determined that no accessory was purchased and sanji assured us that the charge would be removed from the account. last week on 2/21/17 i spoke with sanji again and told him that the charges were still showing on the account. he said he would look in to this and call me back in 2 days and never called back. today i see that on 01/31/17 (the day we went to the store to have the charge removed) that same store added a charge for a purchase of an item with 31 installments being added to our account at $199 and change every month for 31 months. wwireless customer service says that there is no item that costs this much. i am so stressed out and tired of working all day and coming home and having to deal with this and not one person at that store cares that they are making these mistakes. furthermore, both my husband and i have left messages for the area supervisor (or whatever his actual title is) michael moore and he had never returned one call. help! i am absolutely at my wtis end with this nightmare.

docs.title: 3rd time trying to unlock my Samsung Galaxy Express 3.

docs.title: Unlimited Data Limits
docs.text: s the wording in the small print is 'data restrictions: after 22gb of any data usage on a line in a bill cycle, wwireless may slow the data on that line during periods of network congestion for the remainder of that cycle.'does that mean that if you have multiple lines each line has a separate 22gb limit and one line going over the limit doesn't affect the other lines, it's only the line that went over will be throttled?solved!go to solution.

docs.title: AT&T New Unlimited vs. AT&T Unlimited Grandfathered
docs.text: h all -i've had the wwireless unlimited grandfathered plan for many many years now. i saw their new unilimited plan and its features. besides the obvious pros (tethering, lower price) and cons (still being capped at 22gb, which i do not get anywhere near - i usually average around 10), is there anything that i am missing as a con? this new plan would save me about $25/month.thoughts?thanks!-dc
